parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

description: A findings domain that contains physiological and morphological findings related to the male and female reproductive systems. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C102707, 2021-06-25)

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM- based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SUBJID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
fields.implementationNotes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed in the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: VISIT

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date the reproductive system findings were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the reproductive system findings at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the RP CRF using the date (RPDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable RPDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the reproductive system category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included in the column heading.
fields.label: Category for Repro System Findings
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: RPCAT
fields.questionText: What was the category of the reproductive system?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the reproductive system subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the RPCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. RPSCAT can only be used if there is an RPCAT, and it must be a subcategorization of RPCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Repro System Findings
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: RPSCAT
fields.questionText: What was the subcategory of the reproductive system?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate whether or not a planned reproductive system evaluation was done.
fields.definition: An indication of whether a planned measurement, series of measurements, test, or observation was performed.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be implemented for a series of reproductive system evaluations, or a specific reproductive system test. This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.
fields.label: Reproductive System Evaluation Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable RPSTAT. If the CDASH field RPPERF="N", the value of RPSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If RPPERF="Y", RPSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., RPCAT and RPSCAT, RPTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable RPTESTCD would be populated as RPALL and an appropriate test name (RPTEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
fields.name: RPPERF
fields.questionText: Was a reproductive system evaluation performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Provide the reason the measurement or test was not done.
fields.definition: An explanation for why the data are not available.
fields.implementationNotes: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When PCREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable PCSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
fields.label: RP Reason Not Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: RPREASND
fields.questionText: What was the reason the reproductive system test was not collected?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the there are reproductive system findings. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.
fields.definition: General prompt question regarding whether any reproductive system findings are available.
fields.implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.
fields.label: Any Reproductive System Findings
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM annotated CRF indicates that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: RPYN
fields.questionText: Were there any reproductive system findings?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
fields.implementationNotes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record pre-printed number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: RP Sponsor-Defined Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: RPSPID

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C106478

implements.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Select the name of the reproductive system finding, or record if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: Descriptive name for reproductive system finding.
fields.implementationNotes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included in the column heading.
fields.label: Reproductive System Findings Test Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable RPTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in RPTEST. The SDTMIG variables RPTESTCD and RPTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
fields.name: RPTEST
fields.questionText: What is the reproductive finding name?

implements.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

priorVersion.title: RP Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: RP Result or Finding in Original Units

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

self.title: RP Result or Finding in Original Units

fields.definition: Result of the finding defined in reproductive system finding, as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.
fields.label: RP Result or Finding in Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: RPORRES
fields.questionText: What was the result for the reproductive system question?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the original unit in which these data were collected, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field.
fields.label: RP Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: RPORRESU
fields.questionText: What was the unit of the result?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date of collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date on which the reproductive system result or finding was collected, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: This should be a complete date. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT).
fields.label: Reproductive System Finding Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable RPDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: RPDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date the reproductive system question was collected?

label: Reproductive System Findings
name: RP
